intro: Crucianella glauca subsp. transcaucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian sea bean, is a flowering plant species native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It is often found in dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
